result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J. Pastorello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
There is no sentence credit if revoked from Probation.
Concurrent with: Eau Claire County Case 20CF418

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel J. Pastorello

records.addlTxt: Time to pay summary mailed to defendant. JOC emailed to ECJ.
Notice of right to seek post conviction relief.
See plea hearing held 4/19/22 as to the waiver.

10:28 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel J. Pastorello in court.  Attorney William Frederick Laman in court for Samuel J. Pastorello. There is an agreement. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Amended Count 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs (second and subsequent) (no repeater). Defendant acknowledges prior conviction to support enhancer. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 1 year with conditions: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
There is no sentence credit if defendant is revoked. Traffic matters 21TR10439, 21TR10440, 21TR10441, 21TR10442 and 21TR10443 are to be re-opened and dismissed and read in (clerk notes files have already been re-opened and dismissed on 4/11/22).
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Defendant's Memorandum of Law for Sentencing
Dated 04/07/2022, letter from Attorney William Laman, with attachment, for consideration for plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
